And then “The option with because of is, in my opinion, preferable, as “because” is going to be more colloquial/used in conversational speech more often. Also if speakers are going to translate these, then it is going to be better to use this option as well, since the preposition will likely be a more widely understood form.”

glosses_ru: для DEF.F.PL правило.PL математический.F.PL это.M.SG число NEG может.3SG быть.INF меньше.SG от один
back_translation_ru: В силу математических законов, это число не может быть меньше единицы.
sentence_en: <Per> [mathematical law], this number cannot be less than one.

sentence: Hankachi-ga namida-de nure-ta.
back_translation_en: The handkerchief got soaked from tears.
sentence_en: The handkerchief got soaked <from> [tears].

sentence: Eda-ga omo-sa-de ore-ta.
back_translation_en: The branch broke from the weight.
sentence_en: The branch broke <from> [the weight].

sentence: Josei-wa kemuri-no sei-de seki-o sh-ite-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The woman is coughing because of the smoke.
comments_informal: The informants assessed this marker as more preferable than INS.
sentence_en: The woman is coughing <because of> [the smoke].

sentence: Josei-wa kemuri-de sekikon-de-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The woman is coughing because of the smoke.
comments_informal: The informants assessed this marker as less preferable than GEN_sei-INS.
sentence_en: The woman is coughing <because of> [the smoke].

sentence: Kurayami-no sei-de kishi-ga mie-na-i.
back_translation_en: Because of the darkness the shore isn’t visible.
comments_informal: The informants assessed this marker as more preferable than GEN_tame.
sentence_en: We can’t see the shore <because of> [the darkness].

sentence: Kurayami-no tame-ni kishi-ga mie-na-i.
back_translation_en: Due to the darkness the shore isn't visible.
back_translation_ru: По причине темноты не видно берега.
comments_informal: This translation is slightly formal.
sentence_en: We can’t see the shore <because of> [the darkness].

sentence: Dansei-wa machigatte taiho-s-are-ta.
back_translation_en: The man was arrested by mistake.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as an adverb, not a noun phrase.
comments_informal: mistakenly (> make.a.mistake-CVB)
sentence_en: The man was arrested <by> [mistake]. {He has the same name as the criminal}.

sentence: Ki-ga kaze-de taore-ta.
back_translation_en: The tree fell because of the wind.
sentence_en: The tree fell <due to> [the wind].

sentence: Dansei-wa kanden.shokku-de sokushi-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man died immediately from electric shock.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина погиб на месте от удара тока.
sentence_en: The man died <from> [electric shock] {immediately}.

sentence: Josei-wa sōon-de me-ga same-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman woke up from the noise.
sentence_en: The woman woke up <from> [the noise].

sentence: Dansei-wa bīru-no sei-de atama-ga ita-i.
back_translation_en: The man has a headache from the beer.
back_translation_ru: У мужчины от пива болит голова.
sentence_en: The man has a headache <from> [the beer].

sentence: Josei-wa koinu-o warat-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman laughed at the puppy.
comments_informal: One informant assessed such usage of the accusative marker as ungrammatical, but it is well attested in the corpus. In any case o is not used a causal marker with other verbs.
sentence_en: {The puppy tumbled over in a funny way}. The woman laughed <at> [the puppy].

sentence: Dansei-wa dokusei-no sakana-o tabe-te futsuka-go-ni shin-da.
glosses_en: man-TOP poisonousness-GEN fish-ACC eat-CVB two_days-later-DAT die-PST
back_translation_en: The man ate a poisonous fish and died two days later.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина съел ядовитую рыбу и умер два дня спустя.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
sentence_en: The man died <from> [a poisonous fish] {2 days after poisoning}.

sentence: Onna-no ko-wa jibun-no seiseki-ni manzoku-sh-ite-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The girl is satisfied with her grade.
comments_informal: In this case ni seems to be governed by the verb and doesn’t seem to express reason per se.
sentence_en: The girl is satisfied <with> [her grade].

sentence: Tsuma-wa otto-no kotoba-ni hara-o tate-ta.
back_translation_en: The wife was angered by her husband’s words.
comments_informal: In this case the dative NP is more of an adjunct rather than an argument.
sentence_en: {The man said something bad}. The wife was angered <by> [her husband’s words].

sentence: Otoko-no ko-wa kono an-ni ōyorokobi-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The boy was thrilled by this idea.
back_translation_ru: Мальчик в восторге от этой идеи.
comments_informal: Case government?
sentence_en: The boy was thrilled <by> [this idea]. {His dad has suggested to go watch football}.

sentence: Dansei-wa kūfuku-de yowat-ta.
back_translation_en: The man was weakened by hunger.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The man was weakened <by> [hunger].

sentence: Dansei-wa ue-ni yotte suijaku-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man was weakened by hunger.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The man was weakened <by> [hunger].

sentence: Dansei-wa kiga-de shin-da.
back_translation_en: The man died of starvation.
sentence_en: The man died <of> [starvation].

sentence: Dansei-wa itami-de saken-de-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The man screamed from the pain.
comments_informal: Two out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The man is screaming <from> [the pain].

sentence: Dansei-wa itami-kara saken-de-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The man screamed from the pain.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The man is screaming <from> [the pain].

sentence: Josei-wa samu-sa-de furue-te-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The woman is shivering from the cold.
sentence_en: The woman is shivering <from> [the cold].

sentence: Kodomo-wa kyōfu-de nak-i-dash-ita
back_translation_en: The child began to cry out of fear.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The child began to cry <out of> [fear].

sentence: Kodomo-wa kyōfu-no amari nak-i-dash-ita
back_translation_en: The child began to cry out of fear.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The child began to cry <out of> [fear].

sentence: Kodomo-wa ureshiku-te wara-i-dash-ita.
back_translation_en: The child, rejoiced, began to laugh.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used a biclausal construction.
sentence_en: The child laughed <with> [joy].

sentence: Kodomo-wa ureshisa-no amari hageshi-ku wara-i-dash-ita.
back_translation_en: The child laughed vigorously with joy.
comments_informal: This translation, although perfectly natural, is less accurate than the translation with a biclausal construction. One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The child laughed <with> [joy].

sentence: Kodomo-wa kyōfu-de naya-ni kakure-ta.
back_translation_en: The child hid in the barn out of fear.
back_translation_ru: Ребенок от страха спрятался в сарае.
comments_informal: This marker is more frequent than GEN_amari. Two out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The child hid in the barn <out of> [fear].

sentence: Kodomo-wa kyōfu-no amari monooki-ni kakure-ta.
back_translation_en: The child hid in the barn out of fear.
back_translation_ru: Ребенок от страха спрятался в сарае.
comments_informal: This marker is less frequent than INS. One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The child hid in the barn <out of> [fear].

sentence: Dansei-wa kenkyo-sa-kara chinmoku-o tamot-ta.
back_translation_en: The man kept silent out of modesty.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used with this noun more often than yue.
sentence_en: The man kept silent <out of> [modesty].

sentence: Dansei-wa kenkyo-sa yue damat-te-i-ta.
back_translation_en: The man kept silent due to modesty.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used with this noun less often than ABL. The translation is rather formal.
sentence_en: The man kept silent <out of> [modesty].

sentence: Josei-wa kyōfu-de ani-no ude-o tsukan-da.
back_translation_en: The woman grabbed her elder brother’s hand in fear.
back_translation_ru: Женщина в страхе схватила старшего брата за руку.
comments_informal: In the corpus the instrumental marker is used with this noun twice as often as the ablative one. Two out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman grabbed her brother’s hand <in> [fear].

sentence: Josei-wa kyōfu-kara otōto-no ude-o tsukan-da.
back_translation_en: The woman grabbed her yonger brother’s hand out of fear.
back_translation_ru: Женщина от страха схватила младшего брата за руку.
comments_informal: In the corpus the ablative marker is used with this noun twice as rarely as the instrumental one. One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman grabbed her brother’s hand <in> [fear].

sentence: Josei-wa chō.jikan.rōdō-de tsukare-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman is tired from long work.
sentence_en: The woman is tired <from> [work].

sentence: Josei-wa ka-no sei-de ne-rare-na-i.
back_translation_en: The woman can’t fall asleep because of the mosquitoes.
back_translation_ru: Женщина не может заснуть из-за комаров.
sentence_en: The woman can’t fall asleep <because of> [the mosquitoes].

sentence: Mizu-ga tsukiakari-de kagayai-te mie-ru.
back_translation_en: The water looks bright because of the moonlight.
back_translation_ru: Вода кажется светлой из-за лунного света.
sentence_en: The water looks bright <because of> [the moon].

sentence: Inu-no okage-de otoko-wa kari-ni seikō-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: Thanks to his dog, the man had a successful hunt.
back_translation_ru: Благодаря собаке мужчина имел успех на охоте.
sentence_en: <Thanks to> [his dog], the man had a successful hunt.

sentence: Tsuma-wa otto-ni okot-ta.
back_translation_en: The wife got angry at her husband.
comments_informal: Case government? Three out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: {The man said something bad}. The wife was angry <at> [her husband].

sentence: Tsuma-wa otto-ni taishite hara-o tate-ta.
back_translation_en: The wife got angry at her husband.
comments_informal: Case government? One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: {The man said something bad}. The wife was angry <at> [her husband].

sentence: Josei-wa otto-no sei-de shigoto-ni okure-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman was late for work because of her husband.
back_translation_ru: Женщина опоздала на работу из-за мужа.
sentence_en: The woman was late for work <because of> [her husband]. {He forgot his car keys at home}.

sentence: Hitobito-wa jishin-de shibō-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The people died because of the earthquake.
comments_informal: INS is used as a default marker when the reason is a natural phenomenon.
sentence_en: The people died <because of> [the earthquake]. {The miners were trapped in a mineshaft and could not be saved}.

sentence: Subete-no fukō-wa ningen-ni yotte okor-u.
back_translation_en: All misfortunes happen because of humans/people.
sentence_en: All misfortunes happen <because of> [humans/people].

sentence: Shujutsu-no okage-de dansei-wa yo-ku mie-ru yō-ni nat-ta.
glosses_en: operation-GEN thanks_to-INS man-TOP good-ADV be_able_to_see-PRS way-DAT become-PST
back_translation_en: The man can see better now thanks to the operation.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина стал лучше видеть благодаря операции.
sentence_en: The man can see better now <thanks to> [the operation].

sentence: Josei-wa sono dansei-no okage-de iki-te-i-ru.
back_translation_en: The woman is alive thanks to that man.
sentence_en: The woman is alive <thanks to> [that man]. {He found her when she got lost in the forest}.

sentence: Dansei-wa tsuma-ni oroka-sa-kara sono koto-o it-ta.
glosses_en: man-TOP wife-DAT stupidity-NMLZ-ABL this matter-ACC say-PST
back_translation_en: The man told his wife about it out of stupidity.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина рассказал об этом жене по глупости.
sentence_en: The man told his wife about it <out of> stupidity].

sentence: Josei-wa fuchūi-de subet-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman slipped because of carelessness.
comments_informal: In the corpus the instrumental marker is used with this noun twice as often as the ablative one. Two out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman slipped <because of> [carelessness].

sentence: Josei-wa fuchūi-kara subet-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman slipped because of carelessness.
comments_informal: In the corpus the ablative marker is used with this noun twice as rarely as the instrumental one. One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman slipped <because of> [carelessness].

sentence: Pairotto-wa keiken-no okage-de chakuriku-deki-ta.
back_translation_en: The pilot was able to land [the plane] thanks to his experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот смог совершить посадку благодаря своему опыту.
comments_informal: Two informants out of four have tranlsated the stimuli (one from English and one from Russian) with this marker, but in the corpus there are no instances of this marker being used with this noun.
sentence_en: The pilot was able to land the plane <thanks to> [his experience].

sentence: Pairotto-wa keiken-ni yotte chakuriku-ni seikō-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The pilot succeeded in landing [the plane] thanks to his experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот смог успешно совершил посадку благодаря своему опыту.
comments_informal: Even though there are 52 instances of this marker being used with this noun in the corpus, only one informant used it in the translation of the English stimulus.
sentence_en: The pilot was able to land the plane <thanks to> [his experience].

sentence: Pairotto-wa keikenbusoku-no tame chakuriku-deki-na-katta.
back_translation_en: The pilot couldn’t land [the plane] due to the lack of experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот не смог посадить самолет из-за нехватки опыта.
comments_informal: Two informants out of four have tranlsated the stimuli (one from English and one from Russian) with this marker, but in the corpus there are no instances of this marker being used with this noun. This marker seems to be used in more formal discourse.
sentence_en: The pilot could not land the plane <due to> [inexperience].

sentence: Pairotto-wa keikenbusoku-de chakuriku-deki-na-katta.
back_translation_en: The pilot couldn’t land [the plane] due to the lack of experience.
back_translation_ru: Пилот не смог посадить самолет из-за нехватки опыта.
comments_informal: Even though there are 297 instances of this marker being used with this noun (busoku 'lack') in the corpus, only one informant used it in the translation of the Russian stimulus.
sentence_en: The pilot could not land the plane <due to> [inexperience].

sentence: Sensō-chū hitobito-wa kūfuku-kara kusa-o tabe-te-i-ta.
back_translation_en: In wartime, people ate grass out of hunger.
back_translation_ru: Во время войны люди с голода ели траву.
comments_informal: Two out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: In wartime, people ate grass <out of> [hunger].

sentence: Sensō-chū hitobito-wa ue-de zassō-o tabe-te-i-ta.
back_translation_en: In wartime, people ate weed due to hunger.
back_translation_ru: Во время войны люди с голода ели сорняки.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: In wartime, people ate grass <out of> [hunger].

sentence: Josei-wa kōkishin-kara naka-ni hait-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman went inside out of curiosity.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman went inside <out of> [curiosity].

sentence: Josei-wa kōkishin-de naka-ni hait-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman went inside out of curiosity.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The woman went inside <out of> [curiosity].

sentence: Dansei-wa shitto-de tsuma-o korosh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man killed his wife out of jealousy.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used with this noun more often than ABL.
sentence_en: The man killed his wife <out of> [jealousy].

sentence: Dansei-wa shitto-kara tsuma-o korosh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man killed his wife out of jealousy.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used with this noun less often than INS.
sentence_en: The man killed his wife <out of> [jealousy].

sentence: Dansei-wa kyoeishin-kara sore-o minna-ni hanash-ita.
back_translation_en: The man told everyone about it out of vanity.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина всем об этом рассказал из тщеславия.
sentence_en: The man told everyone about it <out of> [vanity].

sentence: Josei-wa ikari-de subete-no shokki-o wat-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman broke all the dishes out of anger.
back_translation_ru: Женщина разбила всю посуду от злости.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used in such context more often than ABL.
sentence_en: The woman broke all the dishes <out of> [anger].

sentence: Josei-wa nikushimi-kara subete-no sara-o wat-ta.
back_translation_en: The woman broke all the dishes out of anger.
back_translation_ru: Женщина разбила всю посуду от злости.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used in such context less often than INS.
sentence_en: The woman broke all the dishes <out of> [anger].

sentence: Josei-wa samu-katta tame kikon-de ne-ta
back_translation_en: The woman was cold, so she slept wrapped up in clothes.
back_translation_ru: Женщине было холодно, поэтому она спала, укутавшись в одежду.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
sentence_en: The woman went to sleep clothed <because of> [the cold]. {Her furnace was broken}.

sentence: Kyōshi-wa seito-no seifuku-o home-ta.
back_translation_en: The teacher commended the student for his uniform.
back_translation_ru: Учитель похвалил ученика за его форму.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the caused event is not explicitly expressed.
sentence_en: The teacher commended the student <for> [his suit].

sentence: Dansei-wa rinjin-o kare-no hatsugen-kara korosh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man killed his neighbor because of his words.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина убил соседа за его слова.
comments_informal: This is the only example which contradicts the hypothesis that the ablative marker kara can only mark inner reason.
sentence_en: The man killed his neighbor <because of> [his words].

sentence: Kodomo-tachi-wa bōru-o megutte kenka-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The children fought over the ball.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used this marker.
sentence_en: The children fought <over> [the ball].

sentence: Kodomo-tachi-wa bōru-no koto-de kenka-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The children fought over the ball.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: The children fought <over> [the ball].

sentence: Otoko-wa sōzoku-o megutte ani-to giron-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man argued with his elder brother over the inheritance.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина поссорился со старшим братом из-за наследства.
comments_informal: In the corpus this marker is used in such context more often than GEN_koto-INS.
sentence_en: The man argued with his brother <over> [the inheritance].

sentence: Otoko-wa isan-no koto-de kyōdai-to kenka-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The man argued with his brother over the inheritance.
back_translation_ru: Мужчина поссорился с братом из-за наследства.
comments_informal: This marker is equally acceptable as o megutte, but is slightly less frequent in the corpus (with these NPs).
sentence_en: The man argued with his brother <over> [the inheritance].

sentence: Josei-wa e-ni hik-are-te sono hon-o kat-ta.
glosses_en: woman-TOP picture-DAT attract-PASS-CVB this book-ACC buy-PST
back_translation_en: The woman bought the book [because she was] attracted by the pictures.
back_translation_ru: Женщина купила эту книгу, (потому что) её привлекли картинки.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
comments_informal: Three out of four informants used the biclausal construction.
sentence_en: The woman bought the book <because of> [the pictures].

sentence: Josei-wa shashin-no tame-ni sono hon-o kōnyū-sh-ita.
glosses_en: woman-TOP photo-GEN sake-DAT this book-ACC purchase-VBLZ-PST
back_translation_en: The woman bought the book for the sake of the photos.
back_translation_ru: Женщина купила эту книгу ради фотографий.
comments_informal: One out of four informants used this marker.

sentence: Josei-wa kigen-ga waru-katta node tomodachi-to aw-ana-katta.
glosses_en: woman-TOP mood-NOM bad-PST because friend-COM meet-NEG-PST
back_translation_en: The woman didn’t meet her friend because she was in a bad mood.
back_translation_ru: Женщина не стала встречаться с подругой, потому что была в плохом настроении.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.

sentence: Mizutamari-ga aru kara, ame-ga fut-ta.
back_translation_en: It rained because there are puddles.
back_translation_ru: Шёл дождь, потому что есть лужи.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.

sentence: Awa-ga deki-ta kara futtō-sh-ita.
back_translation_en: The water has boiled because there are bubbles.
back_translation_ru: Вода уже закипела, потому что есть пузырьки.
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.

sentence: Samu-i kara heya-ni hair-inasai.
back_translation_en: It is cold, so come into the room!
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
sentence_en: Come into the house, <?> [the cold].

sentence: Samu-i kedo boku-no sēta-ga doko?
back_translation_en: It is cold, but where is my sweater?
comments: This translation is not included in the database because the causing event is expressed as a dependent clause, not a noun phrase.
sentence_en: Where is my sweater <?> [the cold].

sentence: Sūgaku-teki riron-ni yotte kono sūji-wa ichi-miman-ni-wa nar-ana-i.
glosses_en: mathematics-REL theory-DAT due this number-TOP one-less-DAT-TOP become-NEG-PRS

sentence: Sūgaku-teki hōsoku-no tame kono sūji-wa ichi-miman-ni-wa nar-ana-i.
glosses_en: mathematics-REL law-GEN cause this number-TOP one-less-DAT-TOP become-NEG-PRS
back_translation_en: Per mathematical law, this number cannot be less than one.
back_translation_ru: Это число не может быть меньше единицы в силу математических законов.
comments_informal: One out of four participants used this marker.
sentence_en: <Per> [mathematical law], this number cannot be less than one.

sentence: l‘igot‘ paik it‘ku-l
back_translation_en: The handkerchief soaked from tears.
sentence_en: The handkerchief got soaked <from> [tears].

sentence: paika-an’e märgästu-i küünge-n perad
back_translation_en: The handkerchief soaked from tears.
sentence_en: The handkerchief got soaked <from> [tears].

sentence: puu murenz‘ d‘üge-mi-št
back_translation_en: The branch broke from the weight.
sentence_en: The branch broke <from> [the weight].

sentence: akk r‘ügü-b savu-s
back_translation_en: The wifeis coughing because of the smoke.
sentence_en: The woman is coughing <because of> [the smoke].

sentence: in’ehmu r’ügü-b tabako-n savu-n perad
back_translation_en: The wifeis coughing because of the tobacco smoke.

sentence: Kobiet-a odwoła-ł-a wspóln-e plan-y z powod-u zł-ego nastroj-u.
glosses_en: woman-NOM.SG cancel-PST-F.SG common-ACC.PL.NVIR plan-ACC.PL from2 reason-GEN.SG bad-GEN.SG.M mood-GEN.SG
back_translation_en: The woman canceled plans with her friend because of her bad mood.

back_translation_ru: Женщина изменила планы из-за плохого настроения.
comments_informal: Probably irrelevant: ‘plans’ in Polish are a little more abstract than in English, and hence this sentence seems like it was unknown, what they actually planned to do, or as if it was sth complicated. It would be much more common to cancel/ ‘odwołać’ sth more concrete: odwołać wyjazd/ spotkanie/ kolację, etc (cancel a trip, meeting, dinner…). What the Poles usually do with their plans is to change them/ zmienić plan/plany. The phrase is both common and a little more polite than ‘cancelling’ – thus in the situation described most people would say that the plans must be changed (‘musimy zmienić plany’), which would imply: of course I want to go out with you, and I will, but not tonight.
sentence_en: The woman canceled plans with her friend <because of> [her bad mood].
